p: Traumatic AR should be diagnosed in time after BCT in the era of echocardiography, but early diagnosis (within 3 days) accounts for only 35%, while 43% were diagnosed after 1 month ( 5). Of the 5 pediatric cases reported, 2 had a significant heart murmur at the initial evaluation ( 10, 11), while 3 were found to have new heart murmurs or heart failure symptoms 7 days, 6 weeks, and 1 month after trauma, respectively ( 12â€“ 14). Valvular dysfunction can gradually worsen to symptomatic heart failure and results in significant morbidity and mortality if not diagnosed early.
